posts.post_content:
Homarid 2.0 2U  
Creature - Homarid  
Homarid 2.0 enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.  
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a +1/+1 counter from Homarid 2.0. If you can't, put two +1/+1 counters on Homarid 2.0.  
1/1

Posted By: Rudyardo (7/31/2011 11:31:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Non-Magic players have the best commentary on Magic ever. When explaining to a female friend what this did, she said,  
  
*"...so you're telling me, this creature has a **period**? It's gets weak and strong on a regular cycle?"*  
  
Oh, [Homarid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Homarid). I love you. Magic just ain't the same these days...

Posted By: Rudyardo (7/31/2011 11:31:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think "high tide/low tide" would have been sufficiently flavorful. The added flavor of passing through "middle tide" twice per cycle is not worth the added back-bending. . . Especially when there's a Pacifism on him.  
Could have even utilized old-fashioned +2/+2 counter technology.  
Man, these things predate Phasing.  
In Terrible Cube, I've killed these once with [Release the Ants](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Release the Ants), once with [Mage il-Vec](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mage il-Vec), and also laughed myself silly to see one blessed with [Battle Mastery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Battle Mastery).
posts.html:
I think "high tide/low tide" would have been sufficiently flavorful. The added flavor of passing through "middle tide" twice per cycle is not worth the added back-bending. . . Especially when there's a Pacifism on him.
Could have even utilized old-fashioned +2/+2 counter technology.
Man, these things predate Phasing.
In Terrible Cube, I've killed these once with Release the Ants, once with Mage il-Vec, and also laughed myself silly to see one blessed with Battle Mastery.
